title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 139.1 - Authority to establish above minimum salary rates
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 139.1 - Authority to establish above minimum salary rates

State Regulations
(a) The Director of Classification and

Compensation of the Department of Civil Service shall have the authority to
approve or to disapprove applications to appoint above the minimum and to
determine the rate above the minimum salary at which appointment of a person
outside State service may be made to a title described in section
139.3. The rate of compensation for
such a person, as determined by the Director of Classification and

Compensation, shall be an amount equal to the minimum of the grade of the title
plus one, two, three or four annual increments of such grade. The Director of

Classification and Compensation shall determine the particular geographical
area or areas or location or locations wherein the rate of compensation in
excess of the minimum shall apply. (b) Any determination of the Director of

Classification and Compensation by which a salary would be increased under this

Part shall be subject to the approval of the Director of the Budget. (c) Each individual appointment under this

Part shall be subject to the determination of the Director of Classification
and Compensation and the approval of the Director of the Budget. No such
approval shall be construed as approval to appoint any other person from
outside State service at a rate above the minimum. Notes

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
